LIS is responsible for the Library, World Wide Web, Reprographics and IT Services. These combine to deliver the key information related services that underpin the College's teaching, research and administrative requirements.
In January 2003 the Library, Web and IT Services moved into the purpose built Andrew Kean Learning Centre. The £
column2: 5 million development delivers an integrated mix of traditional academic support, books, journals and reference materials, and access to the very latest managed learning facilities and information portals through its extensive IT facilities.

column1: All registered students and members of staff of the College can use the Learning Centre once they have obtained their library card, ICT account and password information. Visitors are also welcome to use the library but have no access to the IT facilities.
